data_description.host: The IP address or hostname of the Velbus interface.
data_description.password: The password of the Velbus interface, this is only needed if the interface is password-protected.
data_description.port: The port number of the Velbus interface.
data_description.tls: Enable this if you use a secure connection to your Velbus interface, like a Signum.

network.description: TCP/IP configuration, in case you use a Signum, VelServ, velbus-tcp or any other Velbus to TCP/IP interface.

data_description.port: Select the serial port for your Velbus USB interface.

usbselect.description: Select the serial port for your Velbus USB interface.
usbselect.title: USB configuration

user.description: How do you want to configure the Velbus hub?
user.title: Define the Velbus connection

data_description.vlp_file: Select the VLP file from your filesystem.

vlp.description: You can optionally provide a VLP file to improve module detection. The VLP file is the config file from VelbusLink that contains all module information. If you do not provide it now, you can always add it later in the integration options. Without this file, Home Assistant will try to detect the modules automatically, but this can take longer time and some modules might not be detected correctly.
vlp.title: Optional VLP file

clear_cache_failed.message: Could not cleat the Velbus cache: {error}

set_memo_text_failed.message: Failed to set the memo text on the Velbus module: {error}.

sync_clock_failed.message: Failed to sync the Velbus clock: {error}.

deprecated_interface_parameter.description:
The 'interface' parameter in the Velbus actions is deprecated. The 'config_entry' parameter should be used going forward.

Please adjust your automations or scripts to fix this issue.
deprecated_interface_parameter.title: Deprecated 'interface' parameter

clear_cache.description: Clears the Velbus cache and then starts a new scan.

address.description: The module address in decimal format, if this is provided we only clear this module, if nothing is provided we clear the whole cache directory (all modules) The decimal addresses are displayed in front of the modules listed at the integration page.
address.name: Address

clear_cache.name: Clear cache

scan.description: Scans the Velbus modules, this will be needed if you see unknown module warnings in the logs, or when you added new modules.
scan.name: Scan

set_memo_text.description: Sets the memo text to the display of modules like VMBGPO, VMBGPOD. Be sure the pages of the modules are configured to display the memo text.

address.description: The module address in decimal format. The decimal addresses are displayed in front of the modules listed at the integration page.
address.name: Address

memo_text.description: The actual text to be displayed. Text is limited to 64 characters.
memo_text.name: Memo text

set_memo_text.name: Set memo text

sync_clock.description: Syncs the clock of the Velbus modules to the Home Assistant clock, this is the same as the 'sync clock' from VelbusLink.

config_entry.description: The config entry of the Velbus integration
config_entry.name: Config entry

sync_clock.name: Sync clock
